Package src.symbol

Class SymbolTable

java.lang.Object
src.symbol.SymbolTable
public class SymbolTable extends Object
Represents the SymbolTable used during the symbol handling phase of the program. The SymbolTable stores information about classes, their methods, global variables, and types.

  • Constructor Summary

    SymbolTable()
    Constructor to create a new empty SymbolTable.

  • Constructor Details

    • SymbolTable

      public SymbolTable()
      Constructor to create a new empty SymbolTable.

  • Method Details

    • addKlass

      public boolean addKlass(String id, String parent)
      Adds a new class to the SymbolTable with the specified identifier and parent class.
      Parameters:
      id - The identifier (name) of the class.
      parent - The name of the parent class that this class extends (can be null for no parent).
      Returns:
      True if the class is successfully added, false if a class with the same identifier already exists.

    • getKlass

      public Klass getKlass(String id)
      Get the class (Klass object) with the specified identifier (name) from the SymbolTable.
      Parameters:
      id - The identifier (name) of the class to retrieve.
      Returns:
      The Klass object representing the class with the specified identifier, or null if it does not exist.

    • containsKlass

      public boolean containsKlass(String id)
      Check if the SymbolTable contains a class with the specified identifier (name).
      Parameters:
      id - The identifier (name) of the class to check.
      Returns:
      True if the SymbolTable contains the class, false otherwise.

    • getVar

      public Variable getVar(Function m, Klass c, String id)
      Get the Variable object for a variable with the specified identifier (name) within the scope of a given function and class. This method searches for the variable in the method's local variables (parameters and variables) and then in the class's global variables. It also handles the case when a variable is defined in a parent class and is accessible through inheritance.
      Parameters:
      m - The Function object representing the method (function) where the variable is used.
      c - The Klass object representing the class where the method (function) is defined.
      id - The identifier (name) of the variable to retrieve.
      Returns:
      The Variable object representing the variable with the specified identifier, or null if it does not exist in the given scope.

    • containsVar

      public boolean containsVar(Function m, Klass c, String id)
      Check if a variable with the specified identifier (name) exists within the scope of a given function and class.
      Parameters:
      m - The Function object representing the method (function) where the variable is used.
      c - The Klass object representing the class where the method (function) is defined.
      id - The identifier (name) of the variable to check.
      Returns:
      True if the variable with the specified identifier exists in the given scope, false otherwise.

    • getVarType

      public Type getVarType(Function m, Klass c, String id)
      Get the Type object for a variable with the specified identifier (name) within the scope of a given function and class.
      Parameters:
      m - The Function object representing the method (function) where the variable is used.
      c - The Klass object representing the class where the method (function) is defined.
      id - The identifier (name) of the variable to retrieve its type.
      Returns:
      The Type object representing the type of the variable with the specified identifier, or null if it does not exist in the given scope.

    • getFunction

      public Function getFunction(String id, String classScope)
      Get the Function object for a method with the specified identifier (name) within the scope of a given class. This method searches for the method in the given class and its parent classes (inherited methods).
      Parameters:
      id - The identifier (name) of the method to retrieve.
      classScope - The name of the class where the method is being called (search starts here).
      Returns:
      The Function object representing the method with the specified identifier, or null if it does not exist in the given class or its parent classes.

    • getFunctionType

      public Type getFunctionType(String id, String classScope)
      Get the return Type object for a method with the specified identifier (name) within the scope of a given class.
      Parameters:
      id - The identifier (name) of the method to retrieve its return type.
      classScope - The name of the class where the method is being called (search starts here).
      Returns:
      The Type object representing the return type of the method with the specified identifier, or null if it does not exist in the given class or its parent classes.

    • compareTypes

      public boolean compareTypes(Type t1, Type t2)
      Compare two Type objects and check if they are equivalent. This method is used for type checking to ensure the compatibility of types in assignments, method calls, etc.
      Parameters:
      t1 - The first Type object to compare.
      t2 - The second Type object to compare.
      Returns:
      True if the two Type objects are equivalent, false otherwise.

    • absCompTypes

      public boolean absCompTypes(Type t1, Type t2)
      Compare two Type objects and check if they are exactly the same (not considering inheritance).
      Parameters:
      t1 - The first Type object to compare.
      t2 - The second Type object to compare.
      Returns:
      True if the two Type objects are exactly the same, false otherwise.
